result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Stevenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs  of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge to be paid in $60 per month installments commencing on 5/17/15 and on the 17th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 13 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--0 days credit for time already served given

Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Case called at [mo]
Defendant Tyler J. Stevenson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
Statement made by Mr. Stevenson

The Court sentences Defendant to:

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs  of $243 + $189 Drug Surcharge + $200 DNA Surcharge to be paid in $60 per month installments commencing on 5/17/15 and on the 17th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 13 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--0 days credit for time already served given

recess: 2:35pm
Status conference on April 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 11:02am [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Tyler J. Stevenson in court.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning from the Court, Mr. Stevenson indicates that he was appointed a Public Defender and believes that an attorney would be at his hearing today.
Upon direction from the Court, the Clerk speaks with Atty. De La Rosa who is present on another matter. Atty. De La Rosa confirms that Mr. Stevenson is eligible for services and requests a status be set in approximately 3 weeks. 
DA Happ no objection
recess:11:07am

Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 11:14am. [MK]
Defendant Tyler J. Stevenson in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; the Court refers Mr. Stevenson to the Public Defender's Office- he should go there right after the hearing today. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Megan Heldt
